column4: Whoohoo!  I signed up for google's android app-inventor the day it came out, and I just got my login info today!  Only two months later....
th^2: Eh.  Probably not.  The netbook remix oddly isn't as nice on my netbook as full blown.
ok..
Are you running ubuntu desktop or server?
desktop
CUPS really doesn't eat up much memory or CPU at all.  It doesn't get in the way
Then cups was installed by default.
yes and i removed it. now it wants to do a new install.
probably because one of the things that was updated requires it.  Why do you want it gone so badly?
i dont want useless programs
There are plenty of other, more useless, more intrusive programs that ubuntu comes with.
If you don't want useless programs, you need to look for another distro.  Really.
yes and im gettin rid of them
that is true. used gentoo for a long time. but i really hate to install new distros. i pick one and stick to it
As much as ubuntu annoys me sometimes, I use it because I want up to date packages I don't have to compile myself.
If I recall correctly, any-and-every program that prints in ubuntu, is linked to cups.
that is true. ie with slackware you have to compile like everything because repos are so small
CUPS is pretty cool, work keeping around even.  Go remove F-spot or something useless :)
to run when you log in?  Well there is the GUI... I used that today since .login isn't respected (grr!).
But using it without a gui would be what I really want.
i dont want to learn GUI ways to do things
Me neither, but this is a very gnome-specific distro sometimes.
too true. this is too unfree for me
sorry dude.
